column5: Near our cottage, on Lafontaine Rd, there is a metal fab guy that does some really neat stuff.  These are so cool.  Some are wilderness scenes.  These globes are pretty neat.  I don't want to know how much they are to buy though.

we have a 1/2 one (no top other than a removable one to add wood and reduce sparks) of wild animals.  It wasn't much either as places like CostCo and others are now selling them.  But that image the person making it did a heck of a job!  I'd rather the "death star" then if custom work is in play...

Ok.  I did some googlin'  Turns out they are pretty established and well known.  Very unique and have done some very well known projects, like the steel cone sculptures in front of the Air Canada Centre.  The web site is pretty interesting.  Nice to see a successful business in the little ol town of Lafontaine.  http://www.liwi.ca/
Any idea what they are worth Canuck?  On a side note, my parents used to own the log cabin cottage at the end of the 14th concession, where abouts are you located?

The BBQ shop by me in Oakville had a couple small ones and pricing was around $+600 each. A buddy had one and depending on where you sat the heat coming off certain spots was like a blast furnace  Would be crazy cool to have ones with distinct lakes carved out
If you can find a place to rent a plazma cutter, find yourself some rolled steel and  give it a go yourself.

I'd rather the "death star" then if custom work is in play...  They're available: https://www.google.ca/search?q=deathstar+firepit&num=100&newwindow=1&espv=2&biw=1366&bih=638&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjZgNOBiIbQAhXoz4MKHSbIB40Q_AUICCgB

They're available: https://www.google.ca/search?q=deathstar+firepit&num=100&newwindow=1&espv=2&biw=1366&bih=638&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjZgNOBiIbQAhXoz4MKHSbIB40Q_AUICCgB I'd SO get one but cannot afford to toss out the working one I have to upgrade for "coolness factor" but if I was in need I'd be all over it!
for 16 hundred plus bucks, I will love from afar but would never buy one
The ones, with cook grill, from the PPark across the bay are free....
